data.title: Best Tutors From George Fox University
data.meta_description: Private tutors from George Fox University for on-campus or online tutoring. Let us pair you with expert tutoring, from undergrad to PhD, within 24 hours.
data.text:
...rewarding experience. When the light bulb moment happens with a student, it is the best feeling in the world. Throughout my experience as a Teacher, I have found that not all of students learn the same way, and that some take more time to grasp certain concepts. I know that this feeling can be discouraging...

...academic work, I enjoy being active: running, biking, hiking, and spending time outside. I like to garden, and eat healthy food I grew myself. I have young kids who keep me on the go, always challenging me to learn new things and explore the world in different ways. As your tutor, I hope to get...

...self-sufficient writers. I am available to tutor Spanish courses as well including high school Spanish I, II, III, and IV, as well as college level beginner and intermediate Spanish courses. We will work together not only to perfect grammatical concepts and implement new vocabulary but also to practice circumlocution and improve conversational fluency.

...father of two young children. Currently I teach 7th grade math in Mesa, Arizona. I am in my thirteenth year of teaching (I taught sixth-grade/all content areas for the first 11 years of my career). I am capable of tutoring all core elementary subjects and tutoring math at the middle grades/junior high level. I received...

...many supplemental learning sites available. Not only am I a teacher, but I am editor as well. As the Editor in Chief for the Young Adult online journal, The Crawl Space, I have developed and implemented editorial standards for both style and quality that are used by the editorial team. I have also worked as...

...creative writer, literary scholar, and linguist, who recently graduated from George Fox University with a Bachelor's of Arts in English and a minor in Teaching English as a Second Language (TESOL). My school experience has thus imbued me with fresh knowledge pertaining to the English language, the Spanish language, teaching, and writing. As an aspiring...

I love teaching and I love learning. I have 10 years experience working with kids to help them find their love of learning.

...was on the positive impact that can result from giving students a voice in their own education. Prior to making the move to GFU, I studied paraeducation (instructional assisting, often in special education settings) at Portland Community College and psychology and sociology at Chemeketa Community College. For the past five years, I've worked as a...

...Peri. This summer you can find me at work, in the pool, at a coffee house or out on the trail biking and running. During the school year I attend George Fox University where I frequently am studying in the library, have coffee dates with friends and work out in the gym.

...teach Spanish and English, both as primary and second languages. Finally, I have experience interpreting and translating for schools (parent/teacher conferences), ACCESS, and Walmart at a local level (contacting potential employees who speak Spanish). Learning a foreign language is hard, and I speak from experience. I hope to be able to make learning easier and...

...doctorate in education, a time -tested MBA (with a Certificate of Achievement in Essentials of Business Development), a Bachelor's degree in Human Development, and two decades of teaching experience, which is constantly being refreshed and renewed. Additionally, my extensive experience in the business community and volunteer sector make me an ideal tutor! I have recently...

I am an artist and writer who is passionate about imparting the ability to tell stories to others. I believe that everyone can learn if they are given the right set of tools.

...helping students succeed and develop their strengths! I believe that every student is capable to learn. I believe that every student deserves a fair chance and deserves an education for their entire lives. I have a Bachelor of Arts in English with a Creative Writing emphsis and minors in Writing and Literature. I have my...

...because I love to learn and I love to empower people so that they can grow. the fun of the teaching process for me is not only getting to communicate the process of learning but also to have the opportunity to learn more myself. In addition to a tutor I am a pastor at a...

...- Foundational Science - Foundational Social Studies I have experience with various standardized tests, both taking them and coaching students, with a proven track record of score improvement for my students. I have taken the SAT, GRE and several teacher licensure examinations. I have particular experience with coaching students on MAP testing, test taking strategies,...

I love learning, how your mind grows when you learn new things and are able to see life in different ways. One of my purposes in life is to help others and if I can help someone see the world with new eyes and feel better about themselves, I am very happy.

...is to share the beauty of mathematics with anyone who is willing to hear about it. I have been tutoring for 8 years in various math courses, both as a private tutor and in my university's math department help sessions nightly. As well I am currently a substitute math teacher for a local private school....

To laugh is to learn. I want to teach people to love to learn, and the best way to do that is to make them laugh. I have over twenty years of experience tutoring people in every subject from ABC to Algebra. Let's learn together.

...more than they know and will push their own perceived limits when given a supportive learning environment. My goal is to provide this environment to students whether I am working with them 1:1 through tutoring, or in small or large groups in the classroom.
